byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by William K. Rashbaum and Eli Rosenberg.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA, PIR ZUBAIR SHAH, JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and ADAM GOLDMAN

abstract: In series of interviews with The New York Times, Mohammad Rahami, father of New York and New Jersey bombing suspect Ahmad Khan Rahami, explicitly recounts interactions with FBI agents in 2014 in which he expressed concerns about his son's growing interest in terrorist organizations and jihadist culture;  FBI officials say assessment of younger Rahami found no links to terrorist activities or groups, but it appears Mohammad Rahami did not give them details that are now forthcoming.
lead_paragraph: In interviews, Mohammad Rahami said he warned agents about his son’s interest in terrorist organizations and his admiration of a leading Qaeda propagandist.
snippet: In interviews, Mohammad Rahami said he warned agents about his son’s interest in terrorist organizations and his admiration of a leading Qaeda propagandist....

headline.main: ‘Keep an Eye on Him,’ Ahmad Khan Rahami’s Father Says He Told F.B.I.
headline.print_headline: Father of Bombing Suspect Says He Urged, ‘Keep an Eye on Him’
